alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 2:56PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Houston County in southeastern Alabama, Jackson and eastern Calhoun Counties in the Panhandle of Florida, western Gadsden and northwestern Liberty Counties in Big Bend of Florida, southwestern Decatur and Seminole Counties in southwestern Georgia through 345 PM EDT/245 PM CDT/... At 256 PM EDT/156 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Cottonwood to 9 miles northeast of Stonemill Creek. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Donalsonville, Blountstown, Marianna, Greensboro, Chattahoochee, Malone, Sneads, Gretna, Bristol, Grand Ridge, Greenwood, Altha, Bascom, Rock Bluff, Clarksville, Ocheesee, Juniper, Selman, Crosby and Abe Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
